channel.title: Starcraft II
channel.description:
So i got starcraft II, and i have to say, that it is the best strategy game i have played since the original starcraft. And with blizzards Battle.net 2.0, you dont even have to enter in the product key, all you do it register the game with your battle.net account, then log in when you start the game, and viola, you can play single player, campaigne, or multiplayer.
the mulitplayer in starcraft II is AMAZING, it like playing singleplayer against A.I, but the with updated battle.net, you can become friends with people, play against friends, have A.I in a multiplayer game, if you want more then just 2 players. StarCraft II is amazing
overall score for me is 8.5/10

item.title: Starcraft II
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
Well, in all actuality I had found a funny little glitch thing where units spazz if they patrol too small an area, but it turns out that there is actually a dance command for a number of the units. Still might try making my own by combining the two, cuz the flying buildings spinning around looks pretty funny IMO lol

Read full topic

item.title: Starcraft II
item.dc:creator: DinoThrasher
item.description:
Katana:

Unfortunately, I haven’t had the benefit of playing through SC2, but from what I know of the cryptic ending of the original…

The Zerg aren’t masterminding this. Kerrigan is the Swarm, and if you played Zeratul’s secret mission you get major hints that the one weird guy in the background of Brood War is soon going to screw over EVERYONE - Terrans, Zerg, AND Protoss.

I’m aware the Zerg aren’t masterminding this, I’m just trying to point out that logically it makes sense from what we already know that a hybrid of that kind would exist.

I totally forgot about the secret mission, I really need to replay Starcraft I. I only have the general story memorized and thus am probably forgetting a lot of crucial details.

Read full topic

item.title: Starcraft II
item.dc:creator: Leo99999
item.description:
StarCraft II is the shit. Everyone who whinged/still whinges about it being only 1/3 of a game needs to play it. It is one of the most polished games I have ever played. The DRM is amazingly good (requires one-time activation on internet and that’s it). Has a fantastically presented story that, although simple, is incredibly enjoyable (in the same way cheesy 80’s action flicks are). The story is, by the way, phenomal both in terms of narrative and presentation compared to most games in the RTS genre. The gameplay is fast and frantic, although the game does an incredible job of easing you into the gameplay throughout the campaign. The multiplayer works without a hitch, Battle.net 2.0 is fast, fluid and allows me to easily play fast-paced multiplayer matches. The game is SO balanced that it will actually blow you away.

Phew That’s about half of what is good in this game. BUY IT!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Starcraft II
item.dc:creator: RabidMonkey
item.description:
Guzzi:

Diablo 3? Diablo 2? Diablo? Are you a complete lame, complete noob, or complete idiot? (Partial idiot counts too don’t flame). Who wants to waste their time pretending they are fighting hell demons? A game where the difficulty stays the same if you keep logging endless hours of leveling up? Sounds like 2nd grade shit…I know, cause I got over lame games when I was in 2nd grade.

You have no way of saying how DIII will play since little information is known about the game thus far and the fucking game isn’t even out yet. Don’t make judgements about products before you’ve played them, it just makes you look like an idiot.

Read full topic

item.title: Starcraft II
item.dc:creator: Lord_Grievous
item.description:
I got SC2 yesterday and I really like it. The singleplayer mode is all I care for (campaign and skirmish) since I don’t like playing online.

The fact that you can always download the client after you’ve entered your serial is something I like, just like with certain games on STEAM.

I just hope that when the other games come out that they’ll be expansion packs that aren’t priced at $60.

Read full topic

item.title: Starcraft II
item.dc:creator: blue
item.description:
Zeus:

People are saying the story’s bad, but I like the story. I guess I’m just mentally retarded.

ofc is bad as fuck,
Zeratul- lololol i can see the future with magic lolol

Sarah Kerrigan - im the chosen one, only i can save the universe !!!

Swann - wtf a dwarf in my sc2 ? why ?

Arcturus Mengsk - he is teh devil for no reason at all, eats children shits evil just so you can have the “bad guy”

Tychus Findlay - guys is in more missions than jim, he has half the cg animations for him, pretty much main character next to jim. Also his big betrayal gets hyped up from opening cinematic thorough the whole game,and what ? It never happens, did they forgot about it when making the game, or just run out of funds to do it ? He dies in last 5 s of ending cinematic for no reason O_o This alone makes the plot look like shit.

Matt Horner - he is just useless, he gets cut out of game like 5 misisonns before the end and is never heard of again.

Gabriel Tosh - wtf was the deal with this hippie ?

Prince Valerian - only interesting character, but he shows up at the end of the game O_o

Dr. Ariel Hanson - a filler character, as useless as tosh

Duran - wants to destroy the whole universe by creating hybrids for lulz

And then we got the plot of the whole campaign, we start it of by trying to overthrown mengs, but for some reson this idea is dropped in middle of the game. Kerrigan who is a zerg hitler when she is not busy murderig bilions of humans turns human so we can have a happy ending and a love iterest, not to mention the 10 filler missions in with dr Aril and Tosh, that dont move the story in any direction and break the pacing in every way possible.

The problem with the whole story is pretty obvious, it was written as a 7-8 mission campain, that was extended to a full 26 mission game without any changes in the script so they can cash in more on the game, its just lazy and bad writing made worse by tiring to sell you teh game 3 times.

On other hand a lot of ppl loved the transformers movies, so i bet a lot of ppl will love this story.

Read full topic

item.title: Starcraft II
item.dc:creator: Katana
item.description:
DinoThrasher:

The Hybrids made sense to me. I mean, the Zerg used a psychically enhanced Terran to create a Terran-Zerg hybrid, so it only makes sense that the Zerg would also use the naturally psychic Protoss to create Protoss-Zerg hybrids.

And then I assume they’ll elaborate on it all in the expansions… Or at least, I hope so.

Unfortunately, I haven’t had the benefit of playing through SC2, but from what I know of the cryptic ending of the original…

The Zerg aren’t masterminding this. Kerrigan is the Swarm, and if you played Zeratul’s secret mission you get major hints that the one weird guy in the background of Brood War is soon going to screw over EVERYONE - Terrans, Zerg, AND Protoss.

Read full topic

item.title: Starcraft II
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
mattemuse:

on a different subject, i get huge amounts of speaker noise when I’m playing starcraft II. the game audio is fine, but there’s a constant background static. this only happens when im playing starcraft II. game’s fun, though.

weird, never had that happen

Fnoigy:

OH FUCK THEY’RE INFESTING YOU RUN GET OUT OF THERE!!!

lol

Also the only portrait I’ve unlocked is the adjutant, and that was pretty dang hard for me (mainly just the last achievement, “The Best Defense”), so it looks doubtful I’ll get many more. I just look at all these “Beat 750/1000 games as Terran/Zerg/Protoss” portraits and weep.
